title: 112_s1154
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Promises to Service-Disabled Veterans Act of 2011". Congress acknowledges that federal agencies must comply with the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999, which set a goal for awarding contracts to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Progress in meeting this goal has been slow, and prime contractors working with the government are expected to contribute towards achieving it. Progress in meeting the Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans has been slow. Prime contractors have an obligation to help achieve this goal, and the public has a right to know if it is being met. SEC. 3. TRANSPARENCY IN CONTRACTING GOALS FOR SMALL BUSINESS CONCERNS OWNED AND CONTROLLED BY SERVICE-DISABLED VETERANS. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. This requires covered contractors to submit reports to the Administrator regarding the percentage of total subcontracting value to Executive departments. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments must submit reports to the Administrator on the percentage of prime contracts awarded to these businesses. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments must report the name of each covered contractor awarded a contract, the percentage goal negotiated for subcontracting to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, and the percentage of subcontracts awarded to small business concerns. The amended Small Business Act requires executive departments to report on the percentage of subcontracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, the negotiated subcontracting goal for these businesses, and the total value of subcontracts awarded to them by covered contractors. The Small Business Act amendment mandates executive departments to report subcontracting utilization by small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, including subcontracting goals and total subcontract value. The Administrator ranks contractors annually based on these criteria. The Administrator ranks Executive departments based on the percentage of prime contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans and the percentage of subcontracts awarded by covered contractors to these businesses. The Administrator ranks Executive departments based on the percentage of prime contracts and subcontracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. The Administrator publishes this information on a website. The Administrator ranks Executive departments based on subcontract value awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. The Administrator publishes this information on a public website. The Administrator ranks Executive departments based on subcontract value awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. The rankings are published on a public website, with an exception for national security concerns. The website is updated quarterly, and an annual report on progress is submitted to Congress. The Administrator updates a public website quarterly with subcontracting data from Executive departments. An annual report on progress towards Government-wide contracting goals is submitted to Congress. The report under this paragraph includes a statement on the website's data accuracy and a recommendation for a prime contractor recognized for contracting with service-disabled veteran-owned small businesses.
